meanings.definition: To drag or pull along behind.
meanings.sent1: The child would traik his toy car along the floor.
meanings.sent2: She traiked the heavy suitcase behind her at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The puppy decided to traik the blanket around the house for fun.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past traik behind her like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The old man continued to traik his tired body up the hill.

meanings.definition: A trail or track left by something moving.
meanings.sent1: The hikers followed the traik through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The traik of the car's tires was visible in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The snail left a shiny traik behind as it crawled along.
meanings.sent4: The traik of stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The traik of breadcrumbs led them out of the maze.

meanings.sent1: After a long day, she began to traik up the stairs to bed.
meanings.sent2: The old dog traiked behind its owner on the walk.
meanings.sent3: The tired student traiked into the classroom just before the bell.
